title: The Transfer
mechanic: All start 0 Vice. Reputation +20%. No Breakdowns.
content_preview: The bell doesn't ring. It stutters. A metallic echo that feels delayed like the building is buffering itself into existence. You don't remember arriving. You don't remember freshman year. You only remember almost making it.

title: The Chart
content_preview: The seating chart is laminated. Heavy lamination. The kind that suggests permanence even though you watched Nate move tables twice yesterday. The Chart hovers in the center of the cafeteria rotating slowly.

title: The Audition
content_preview: Valedictoria Vance has never looked up from her spreadsheet. The Honor Roll table has coasters. For the milk cartons. Rules: No elbows on the table. No noise above 40 decibels. No fun.

title: The Party
content_preview: The doors to the parking lot slide open. No announcement. No one needs to. The first party is a ritual. The parking lot isn't a parking lot. It extends further than geometry allows.

title: The JV Bench
content_preview: You find them behind the bleachers. Not hiding. Just waiting. JV Jimmy. JV Jorge. JV Jamal. Same letterman jackets as Chad but the letters are different. Smaller. Junior Varsity. The B-Team.

title: Weekend - Good
content_preview: The cafeteria doesn't empty on weekends. It transforms. The fluorescent lights dim to a warmer spectrum. Not warm like sunlight. Warm like a computer screen in a dark room.

title: The Déjà Vu
mechanic: Dueling Rep +100. First Vice on loss.
content_preview: The bell rings. It rings five minutes late. Yesterday it rang on time. The day before: six minutes late. The pattern isn't patterning. You're certain the Preps were on the left. Now they're center-right.

title: Student Government
content_preview: The nominations are posted on the wall. Not the Seating Chart wall. A different wall. A wall that wasn't there yesterday. Valedictoria's name is already on the ballot. Written in permanent marker. The marker is still wet.

title: Open Mic Night
content_preview: The microphone is a prop. It doesn't amplify. But when Conspiracy Kyle speaks into it the cafeteria listens. Not the people. The building itself. The walls absorb his words. The lights flicker in rhythm with his poetry.

title: The First Vice
content_preview: You feel it when you lose. Not dramatically. Subtly. A warmth at the edge of your card. A glow that wasn't there before. The Dropout sees it. He nods. Not in judgment. In recognition. "Welcome to the club" his eyes say.

title: The Spreadsheet
content_preview: Valedictoria shows you the hidden tab. ESCAPE_ATTEMPTS_LOG. 2009: Perfect GPA. Failed. 2015: McKinsey Offer. Failed. 2026: ??? PENDING. The last entry is today. Your arrival.

title: Weekend - Good
content_preview: Nate finds you in the parking lot. He's sitting in the '72 Impala. The engine is running. There's no key in the ignition. "I need to tell you about Subject 891" he says. "The one who graduated perfectly."

title: The Doors Open
content_preview: Month One Week Three. The doors to the parking lot don't just open. They breathe. Inhale. Exhale. The threshold pulses like a heartbeat. The Freaks are already there. They never wait for permission.

title: Parking Lot Ritual
content_preview: The cars arrange themselves in a circle. Headlights on. Pointing inward. Creating a arena of light and shadow. Stacy Status stands on a hood. Her card projects above her: VILLAIN ERA. Her Reputation fluctuates wildly. She smiles at the volatility.

title: The First Breakdown
content_preview: You see it happen. Not to you. To a Geek. His name tag says LAN Party Larry. He's been winning. Too much. His Stability drops below threshold. His card doesn't just crack. It glitches. For a moment you see him older. Thinner. Sitting alone.

title: The Disappearance
content_preview: Someone disappears. Not explodes. Not fades. Just—absence. Where they stood: an empty space. The grass doesn't grow there anymore. The cafeteria population counter if you could see it would read: 98. But you can't see it yet.

title: The Morning After
content_preview: No one mentions the disappearance. You ask Nate. He looks at you blankly. "Who?" You describe them. The clothes. The card. The way they laughed. Nate shakes his head. "Sounds like a glitch. The system corrects."

title: The Lunch Lady Knows
content_preview: She finds you at the milk dispensers. The milk is expired. The expiration date is tomorrow. "You noticed" she says. Not a question. "Most don't. Most can't. The loop protects them from knowing."

title: Weekend - Good
content_preview: The yearbook opens to a page you haven't seen. A photo of the cafeteria. Empty. No students. Just tables. And on every table: a card. Face down. Waiting. The caption: "Class of ∞. Voted Most Likely To Exist."

title: The Screenshots
content_preview: Month One Week Four. The rumors start as whispers. Then screenshots. Then the Screenshots start circulating. Evidence of things that didn't happen. Conversations you don't remember having. Cards you didn't play. Vice you didn't earn.

title: False Memory
content_preview: You remember a duel that didn't happen. You remember losing to Chad. But you beat Chad. Didn't you? You check your card. There's a crack you don't remember. Or was it always there?

title: The Trap
content_preview: Valedictoria sets a Trap. Not in a duel. In conversation. She asks about your life before. Your real life. The life outside. And as you answer you realize: you don't know. You don't remember your mother's name. Your hometown. Just the almosts.

title: The Glitch
content_preview: The Seating Chart glitches. For three seconds it shows next month's positions. You see yourself at the Center Table. You see the empty chair closer. You see a figure standing where the chair was. Tall. Featureless. The Principal.

title: The Correction
content_preview: The Chart returns to normal. But something is wrong. The Preps are quieter. The Geeks have closed their laptops. The Freaks are sitting still. For the first time: stillness.

title: The Empty Chair
content_preview: You approach the front of the cafeteria. The empty chair is closer than Day One. You can see scratches on the floor where it used to be. Drag marks. Like it moved itself. Or something moved it.

title: Weekend - Good
content_preview: The Lunch Lady finds you. "Month Two starts Monday" she says. "Sophomore Year. The déjà vu year. You'll remember fragments. Don't trust them. The loop wants you to think you understand. Understanding is the trap."

title: The Last Day
content_preview: The final duel of Month One. It doesn't matter who you face. The outcome is predetermined. You will win. You will gain Reputation. You will feel accomplished. And you will not notice that the empty chair moved again. Closer. Always closer.

title: The Reset
content_preview: You wake up. The bell stutters. The lights flicker. The cafeteria buzzes. Nate flips his coin. "New kid?" he asks. But something is different. A crack in your card art. A memory fragment. A feeling that you've been here before. Because you have.

title: Month Two Begins
content_preview: The tables have moved. The Preps are where the Geeks were. The Dropouts have migrated to the windows. You must change one Stereotype in your deck. Forced adaptation. The loop demands evolution.

title: Déjà Vu
content_preview: You remember this conversation. Chad's challenge. Valedictoria's spreadsheet. But the details are wrong. The colors are off. The timing is different. You're remembering Month One but filtered through Month Two.
